task_summary: Detect and grasp the white plate, move to the red plate area, gently make contact, place the white plate on top of the red plate, release, and retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A fixed-base manipulator with a parallel gripper operates on a tabletop with a white plate and a red plate. The goal is to pick up the white plate and place it centered on the red plate. The sequence includes perception, approach, grasping with a top strategy, transferring to the red plate region, gentle contact-based placing, release, and retreat. Movements stay above the table except during controlled descent. Actions use bounded timeouts and tight alignment tolerance suitable for dishware.
preconditions: Robot powered, calibrated, and workspace cleared
White plate and red plate visible on the table
Collision model and safe heights configured
stepwise_plan: Open gripper and detect white plate
Move above and compute top grasp for the white plate
Align precisely and execute grasp; verify stability
Detect red plate and move above its center
Lower until contact and place with a small press
Open gripper to release and retreat to a safe pose
success_criteria: White plate securely grasped before transfer
White plate ends up resting on red plate with no slip
Robot in a safe, collision-free final pose
failure_and_recovery: Perception miss: re-detect target or adjust view
Unstable grasp: re-open, re-compute grasp, and retry
Premature contact: retreat slightly and re-approach
Placement off-center: re-align above red plate and re-place
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the white plate is placed on the red plate and the arm has retreated to a safe pose.

frame_3.now_evidence: Gripper closely aligned to the rim of the white plate indicating imminent grasp.
frame_3.predicts_next: Successful closing or lift is expected in the next step.

task_instruction: Pick up a white plate, and then place it on the red plate.

node_specs.description: Ensure gripper is open before approach.
Position above the white plate at safe height.
Compute a top grasp for the plate.
Locate the red plate for placement.
Place the white plate on the red plate.

failure_modes: White plate not detected or occluded
Hard contact during placement causing displacement
recovery_strategy: Re-run detection with slight view change
Re-compute grasp and re-align with tighter tolerance
Lower slowly and check stability before transfer
Use contact sensing and micro-adjust before release
assumptions: Frames suggest successful grasp then motion toward the red plate; exact center alignment and release timing inferred from typical sequence.
No textual hints about force or retries; defaults selected within allowed bins.

expected_success_criteria: ContactDetected during lowering then OpenGripper executes
White plate visually over red plate after release
